This makes your log readable because all the weird ascii characters that usually occur because of different coloured text in the client (and because of weird symbols - ocrana led's etc) are converted into printable characters.

lookspring.desc: This variable toggles the centering of the screen after the -klook command.

lookstrafe.desc:
This variable toggles the automatic strafing when the +klook command is used.
When set to "1" and the player used the +klook command, the keys that are bound 
to the +left and +right commands will now act as if they were bound to +moveleft 
and +moveright. This command was put it in order to allow keyboard player to 
combine the +strafe and +klook commands into one.
This command also has effect on the mouse controls. When set to "1" moving the 
mouse left and right will make the player move left and right instead of making 
him turn left and right.

m_accel.desc: Values >0 will amplify mouse movement proportional to velocity. Small values have great effect. A lot of good Quake Live players use around the 0.1-0.2 mark, but this depends on your mouse CPI and polling rate.

m_accel_power.desc: Values 1 or below are dumb. 2 is linear and the default. Above 2 begins to amplify exponentially and you will get more acceleration at higher velocities. Great if you want low accel for slow movements, and high accel for fast movements. Good in combination with a sensitivity cap (m_accel_senscap)

m_accel_senscap.desc: Sets an upper limit on the amplified mouse movement. Great for tuning acceleration around lower velocities while still remaining in control of fast motion such as flicking.

m_accel_offset.desc: Acceleration will not be active until the mouse movement exceeds this speed (counts per millisecond). Negative values are supported, which has the effect of causing higher rates of acceleration to happen at lower velocities.

m_filter.desc:
This variable toggles mouse input filtering. When set to "1", the values which
are received from the mouse's input will first be averaged together and then 
that value will be used in the game. 
The reason for this command is that some mice had problems with sending sporadic
coordinates which make the input from the mouse jerky, also when using a serial 
or PS/2 mouse, the Windows operating system will only sample mouse input every 
25ms, that is 40 times a second (for USB mice the sample rate is 125 Hz, that is
every 8 ms). When set to "1" this variable will smooth out the input but it will 
cause latency between the movement of the mouse and the actual response in the 
game. When using a PS/2 mouse it is thus first recommended to try to increase 
the sampling rate either by changing it via your mouse driver or by using the 
ps2rate program which can be downloaded at ps2rate homepage . 
If you are playing the game at frame rates above 40 FPS and if you can't 
increase the sampling rate of your PS/2 rate or if you are playing with a serial 
mouse it is recommended that you enable this toggle.

values.name: true
values.description: If you have problems to get MWHEELUP and MWHEELDOWN working set this to 1.

m_forward.desc:
This variable controls how fast the player should move forward and back when the 
mouse is moved forward and back. This command has no effect if the +mlook 
command is in effect because when the mouse is moved forward and back the 
player looks up and down instead of moving forward and back. Some players might 
want to set this variable to "0" if they happen not to use +mlook constantly and 
they only want to use the mouse to turn the player. Setting this variable to "0"
will prevent the inadvertent movement of the player forward and back while 
trying to make precise turns with the mouse.

m_pitch.desc:
This variable sets the level of precision when the mouse is used to make the 
player look up and down while the +mlook command is in effect. By default this 
variable is set in such a way that moving the mouse forward makes the player 
look up and moving the mouse backward makes the player look down. Some people 
prefer to have this movement inverted just like it is inverted for airplane 
controls. If you wish to use this inverted mouse movement then you should set 
this variable to a negative value (for example "-0.022"). It is a matter of 
preference which movement method is used by players. Also lowering the value 
for this variable will increase the level of precision when the mouse is used 
to make the player look up and down. This variable can be used separately from 
the sensitivity variable to provide greater control over the mouse sensitivity 
for movement along the pitch. It is advisable to keep the value for this 
variable constant at 0.022 or -0.022 and instead use the sensitivity variable 
to change the overall sensitivity of the mouse. Also, some script writers lower 
the value for this variable along with a lowered value for the fov variable in 
order to provide more precision when the fov variable is used to zoom.

m_rate.desc:
This variable should be set to your mouse rate (in Hz).
Note: need -m_smooth and -dinput to commandline.

m_side.desc:
When the +strafe command is active or when "lookspring" is set to "1" this 
variable is used to control the sensitivity when the mouse is moved left and 
right to make the player move left and right.

m_yaw.desc:
This variable controls how fast the player turns left and right when the mouse 
is moved left and right. It is recommended that this variable be left alone and
instead the "sensitivity" variable is used to change the level of precision. 
If you set this variable to a negative value you will reverse the mouse 
movement. Some script writers use this variable to increase the level of 
precision when the "fov" variable is used to zoom the screen.

values.description: Demo will be recorded but requires manual saving with match_save
Automatically saves the demo after the match is completed.

match_auto_spectating.desc: When set to 1, auto recording will also occur when in spectator mode.

values.name: false
values.description: Don't auto record demos in spectator mode.

values.name: true
values.description: Auto record demos even in spectator mode.

match_auto_sshot.desc: Set to 1 to automatically take a screenshot of the final scoreboard when a match ends. If your console is down or you are in the menus, then the client will remove the console/menu for a split second so it can take a screenshot of the scoreboard without any interference.

values.name: true
values.description: Take auto screenshot on match end.

match_auto_unminimize.desc: Bring client from minimized state on countdown start.

match_challenge.desc: When enabled, sends announcements to duel ladder server about match start and match end. Can be activated by special startup *.qw file or by opening special qw: URL.

match_challenge_url.desc: Web address where POST requests announcing challenge match start and end will be sent.

match_format_2on2.desc: Each match category has a name format variable associated with it. This variable is called match_format_<category>. For example, there is match_format_duel, match_format_2on2, etc, etc. All these variables can contain macro's that are expanded according to the macro list given below.  You can also use the "match_format_macrolist" command inside the client to display a list of the macros and their meaning.
match_format_2on2.remarks: See 'match_format_macrolist' command and Match tools manual for more info.

values.description: This pattern will be used in following situation: (gamedir = "qw", 2 teams with at least 1 team having 2 people)

match_ladder_id.desc: Identification of the current duel ladder. Not used right now, always 1.

match_name_and.desc: Used for separating names in %k and %l.

match_name_nick.desc: %n uses this if its not "", otherwise it uses your in game name.

match_name_spec.desc: This is placed after your nick when using %n and are in spec mode. Eg. if you use "match_name_nick foo" and leave match_name_spec default, then %n will be "foo(SPEC)" in spec mode and "foo" when not in spec mode.

maxclients.desc: Highest number of players allowed on the server

maxspectators.desc: Highest number of spectators allowed to connect to the server

menu_advanced.desc: Shows/hides advanced options entries in the Options menu

menu_ingame.desc: Enables/disables ingame menu - menu that typically appears if you press Esc key during the game.

menu_marked_bgcolor.desc: The color of the selected entry in options menu.

menu_marked_fade.desc: Speed of menu entry highlight flashing. Zero disables the flashing effect.

mp3_player.desc: Selects the MP3 player that will be controlled within EzQuake.
mp3_player.remarks:
Windows - winamp supported
Linux - audacious, xmms2, xmms, mpd supported
Mac - None

mp3_scrolltitle.desc: Toggles scrolling of the song info in mp3 player control window.

values.name: false
values.description: Do not scroll song info text.

mp3_showtime.desc: Toggles displaying song time information in mp3 player control window.

values.description: Do not display song time information.
Display song time and total time of currently played song.

mp3_winamp_dir.desc: Tells your client the path where it should look for your external music player.

values.description: Filters mm1, mm2, and spec messages

mtu.desc: Maximum transmission unit size.  Suggests maximum packet size to server, if supported

mumble_enabled.desc: Turn on mumble positional audio support.
mumble_enabled.remarks: Requires mumble to be loaded before toggling this on.

mvd_autohud.desc: Will load different Head Up Display settings when watching MultiView Demos.

values.description: Will load appropriate config according to current match type. Possible types: 1on1, 4on4, custom. Config is like cfg/mvdhud_4on4.cfg

mvd_autotrack.desc: Turns auto-tracking function ON / OFF. This feature can be used while watching MultiView Demo. The client will choose and switch to the best player point of view using appropriate algorithm.
mvd_autotrack.remarks: You can change the switching algorithm properties using mvd_autotrack_1on1, mvd_autotrack_2on2, etc. variables. The setting no. 4. cannot be customized and is independent on other autotrack client settings, except of mvd_autotrack_lockteam

values.description: Autodetect current gametype and use the appropriate xonx settings
Force the use of mvd_autotrack_custom* settings
Enables the use of mvd_multitrack_1 - 4 allowing to set seperate algorthms for every window with cl_muiltiview 2-4
Simple algorithm which prefers pent+rl over quad+rl, quad+rl over pent, quad over noquad, weapon over no weapon player; cannot be customized

mvd_autotrack_1on1.desc: Will be used if mvd_autotrack = 1 and a 1on1 game is played. Its an algorythm for selecting the best player.
mvd_autotrack_1on1.remarks: For a full description read the manual.

mvd_autotrack_1on1_values.desc: Allows you to customize autotrack algoritm. See autotrack manual page for more info.

mvd_autotrack_2on2.desc: Will be used if mvd_autotrack = 1 and a 2on2 game is played. Its an algorythm for selecting the best player.
mvd_autotrack_2on2.remarks: For a full description read the manual.

mvd_autotrack_2on2_values.desc: Allows you to customize autotrack algoritm. See autotrack manual page for more info.

mvd_autotrack_4on4.desc: Will be used if mvd_autotrack = 1 and a 4on4 game is played. Its an algorythm for selecting the best player.
mvd_autotrack_4on4.remarks: For a full description read the manual.

mvd_autotrack_4on4_values.desc: Allows you to customize autotrack algoritm. See autotrack manual page for more info.

mvd_autotrack_custom.desc:
Will be used if mvd_autotrack = 2.
 Its an algorythm for selecting the best player.
mvd_autotrack_custom.remarks: For a full description read the manual.

mvd_autotrack_custom_values.desc: Allows you to customize autotrack algoritm. See autotrack manual page for more info.

mvd_autotrack_instant.desc: Makes mvd_autotrack always find the best player and switch to him instantly.
mvd_autotrack_instant.remarks: In KTPro autotrack tracked player is changed only when some events happen. In instant mvd_autotrack tracked player is changed everytime a better player is found.

values.name: false
values.description: mvd_autotrack will work more like ktpro autotrack

values.name: true
values.description: player change will happen more often

mvd_autotrack_lockteam.desc: If set to 1, autotrack will keep switching POVs only from players within the same team.

values.name: false
values.description: Autotrack will switch between all players.

values.name: true
values.description: Autotrack will stay within one team.

mvd_info.desc: When watching Multi View Demo (.mvd) you can show a table on the screen with full info about players' status.
mvd_info.remarks: See mvd_info_setup for setting up displayed informations.

mvd_info_show_header.desc: Will show a line above the mvd_info table telling you wich column is armor/health/location etc.

mvd_info_x.desc: You can adjust horizontal placement of Players' info table
mvd_info_x.remarks: See scr_mvdinfo and scr_mvdinfo_setup description for more details.

mvd_info_y.desc: You can adjust vertical placement of Players' info table
mvd_info_y.remarks: See scr_mvdinfo and scr_mvdinfo_setup description for more details.

mvd_moreinfo.desc: When playing MultiView Demo (MVD), you can turn on more messages printed in the console, like those you might know from moreinfo command in ktpro. E.g.: Nabbe picked up quad.

mvd_multitrack_1.desc:
Will be used if mvd_autotrack = 3 and cl_multiview is enabled.
Its an algorythm for selecting the best player on viewport 1
mvd_multitrack_1.remarks: For a full description read the manual.

mvd_multitrack_1_values.desc: Allows you to customize autotrack algoritm. See autotrack manual page for more info.

mvd_multitrack_2.desc:
Will be used if mvd_autotrack = 3 and cl_multiview is enabled.
Its an algorythm for selecting the best player on viewport 2
mvd_multitrack_2.remarks: For a full description read the manual.

mvd_multitrack_2_values.desc: Allows you to customize autotrack algoritm. See autotrack manual page for more info.

Its an algorythm for selecting the best player on viewport 3

mvd_multitrack_4_values.desc: Allows you to customize autotrack algoritm. See autotrack manual page for more info.

mvd_pc_pent_1.desc:
Describes the position and viewing angles of the p1 cam.
x y z rot_x rot_y

mvd_pc_pent_2.desc:
Describes the position and viewing angles of the p2 cam.
x y z rot_x rot_y

mvd_pc_pent_3.desc:
Describes the position and viewing angles of the p3 cam.
x y z rot_x rot_y

mvd_pc_quad_1.desc:
Describes the position and viewing angles of the q1 cam.
x y z rot_x rot_y

mvd_pc_quad_2.desc:
Describes the position and viewing angles of the q2 cam.
x y z rot_x rot_y

mvd_pc_quad_3.desc:
Describes the position and viewing angles of the q3 cam.
x y z rot_x rot_y

mvd_pc_view_1.desc: Sets the powerup camera for viewport 1

mvd_pc_view_2.desc: Sets the powerup camera for viewport 2

mvd_pc_view_3.desc: Sets the powerup camera for viewport 3

mvd_pc_view_4.desc: Sets the powerup camera for viewport 4

mvd_powerup_cam.desc: Will enable powerupcams, cams will be enabled on every viewport 5 seconds before the powerup spawns.
mvd_powerup_cam.remarks:
For setting up the viewports cams look at 
mvd_pc_view_1-4
and for setting the locations of the cams look at
mvd_pc_quad_1-3
mvd_pc_pent_1-3

mvd_status.desc:
Shows information of the player you are currently tracking.
Information includes.
taken/dropped items and powerups
last 3 runs (including the current one) run is from powerup-took/spawn to powerup-end/death

mvd_status_x.desc: Adjusts the horizontal placement of mvd_status table

mvd_status_y.desc: Adjusts the vertical placement of mvd_status table

mvd_write_xml.desc: Enables dumping of XML stats from a MVD.

noaim.desc: This variable toggles whether a server-sided aiming-help should be used when shooting rockets (not possible when the server variable "sv_aim" is set to "0").

values.name: false
values.description: Enable server-side aiming help for rockets (if allowed by the server).

values.name: true
values.description: Disable server-side aiming help for rockets.
Enable skins but do not download new skins.

password.desc: Password players have to use to connect to local server

pm_airstep.desc: Airstep player-move-extension. Changes the physics of the game and allows to do jumps on stairs.

pm_bunnyspeedcap.desc:
This is experimental code intended to restore class balance in TF. If you set 
this cvar to something like 1.5 or 2, a solider will not be able to bunnyhop as 
fast as a scout does :) Note that this cvar is optional and disabled by default, 
so it will in NO WAY affect gameplay unless you set it explicitly to anything 
but 0.

pm_ktjump.desc: You can change value of ktjump.

pm_pground.desc: Enables 'persistent onground flag' physics tweak.  Its only use is that it makes pm_airstep work better.
pm_pground.remarks: This extension makes use of Z_EXT_PF_ONGROUND to ensure correct movement prediction by clients. Prediction errors shouldn't be very noticeable anyway even with old clients.

pm_slidefix.desc: When set to 1, Upon decsension from a sloped surface, the player doesn't "drop" (which is a bug in QW), but smoothly slides, as it was in NQ.

pushlatency.desc: This variable is outdated and exists for compatibility with old configs.

qconsole_log_say.desc: Log chat messages into the main server console log.

qport.desc: Local port the client uses to connect to servers

qtv_adjustbuffer.desc: Enables balancing of the buffer length of the QTV stream. When turned on, the size of the stream buffer (the delay from the actual action) will be auto-adjusted (by changing the playback speed when necessary) so that it stays on the same level most of the time.
qtv_adjustbuffer.remarks: When turned on, the speed of the playback may change sometimes - that's how the buffer lenght is balanced. But usually you want to have this turned on when you are watching a shoutcast-commentated game because you want to stay synchronized with the commentary.

values.name: false
values.description: Do not adjust buffer size, always play at 100% speed

qtv_adjusthighstart.desc: The level on which QTV buffer auto-adjusting will start. E.g. when set to 1.5, (and qtv_adjustbuffer is 1), QTV buffer auto-adjusting will start when buffer length reached 150% of it's normal length (determined by qtv_buffertime setting)

values.description: Only values higher than 1.0 make sense

qtv_adjustlowstart.desc: The bottom level on which QTV buffer auto-adjusting will start. E.g. when set to 0.5, (and qtv_adjustbuffer is 1), QTV buffer auto-adjusting will start when buffer length reached 50% of it's normal length (determined by qtv_buffertime setting)

values.description: Only values lower than 1.0 make sense

qtv_adjustmaxspeed.desc: The fastest possible playback speed when QTV buffer becomes excessive and auto-adjusting starts. The higher the speed is, the faster the QTV buffer length will go down to normal levels.

qtv_adjustminspeed.desc: The slowest possible playback speed when QTV buffer adjusting takes action. The slower the speed is, the faster the QTV buffer will fill up.
qtv_adjustminspeed.remarks: Not allowing to slow down enough, buffer level might still drop down to zero if there were longer network lag. This causes pausing during playback. Allowing to slow down too much is noticeable.

values.description: 0.5 means 50% of the normal playback speed

qtv_allow_pause.desc: Allows QTV streams to be affected by cl_demospeed.

qtv_api_url.desc: URL used by /qtv command to resolve servers to QTV addresses and vice versa

qtv_buffertime.desc: Defines how much the client buffers from the QTV stream
qtv_buffertime.remarks: This determines the "delay" you will get from what is actually happening. For example if you want to synchronize shoutcast commentary with the QTV stream, this is the variable you need to change.

values.description: in seconds, values below 0.2 are treated as 0.2

qtv_chatprefix.desc: String that will be added at the beginning of all messages send to a QTV chat.

qtv_event_changename.desc: Text pattern used when an user changes his name on a QTV stream

qtv_event_join.desc: Text pattern used when an user joins a QTV stream

qtv_event_leave.desc: Text pattern used when an user leaves a QTV stream

qtv_gamechatprefix.desc: String that will be added at the beginning of all messages send from QTV to the server where the broadcasted game is being played.

qtv_maxstreams.desc: Maximum number of simultaneous QTV connections.

qtv_password.desc: Password required for QTV to connect to the streamport.

qtv_pendingtimeout.desc: Number of seconds to wait before timing out a pending QTV connection.

values.name: false
values.description: say_team will be blocked when sending to QTV

values.name: true
values.description: say_team allowed as normal on QTV

values.name: false
values.description: QTV chat messages will have prefix detailing userIDs and proxy addresses

values.name: true
values.description: QTV chat messages will be in simpler form <name>: <message>

qtv_streamport.desc: Server variable, TCP port on which the server will listen for QTV connections.

qtv_streamtimeout.desc: Number of seconds to wait before timing out a QTV stream.

values.description: Use path relative to you quakedir

r_aliastransadj.desc:
Not much is known about this variable except for that increasing the value will
cause the player models to be displayed smaller.

r_aliastransbase.desc:
Not much is known about this variable except for that increasing the value will
cause the player models to be displayed smaller.

r_ambient.desc:
This variable controls the amount of ambient lighting on the map. When this 
variable is increased the map will become brighter and all walls and objects 
will be rendered in a lighter color.
It was removed in QWCL and has been re-introduced in this client, however it 
can only be used when the server is running with cheats enabled (for example 
"qwsv -cheats"), because it could be used as a cheat by making it easier to see
players in dark corners when no fullbright skins are used.

r_bloom.remarks: Lights will have a \"diamond\" effect near them

r_bloom_alpha.desc: Transparency level of the blooming effect

r_bloom_darken.desc: Level of \"darkness\" of the blooming effect

r_bloom_diamond_size.desc: Size of the diamond particle used in the blooming effect

r_bloom_fast_sample.desc: Faster variant of the blooming effect.

r_bloom_sample_size.desc: Size of the particle used in the blooming effect

values.description: 0 mean no icons at all, 0.5 mean half opacity and 1 is opaque.

r_clearcolor.desc: This variable changes the color of the areas outside the map, commonly seen when free floating as a spectator.

r_damagestats.desc: Displays the amount of damage taken recently on the screen above your armour and health.

r_drawentities.desc:
This variable can be used to disable that any object entities are drawn. This 
command is useful to map authors who wish to take a look at their map without 
drawing any objects such as lifts, buttons, platforms or items.

r_drawflat.desc: Disables textures and walls and floors them with a solid color (/r_wallcolor or /r_floorcolor) depending on the angle.
r_drawflat.remarks: Usually used for performance improvements at the expense of eyecandy. See r_wallcolor and r_floorcolor.

values.description: Use textures for walls and floors.
Use a solid color for walls and floors
Use solid floors and textured walls.
Use solid walls and textured floors.

r_draworder.desc: Allows you to see through object - for development purposes only.
r_draworder.remarks: Not allowed in multiplayer. See 'developer 1' too.

values.name: false
values.description: Standard behaviour - first draws object far from you then closer to you.

values.name: true
values.description: First draws closest object, then the more distanced ones.

r_drawviewmodel.desc: Controls transparency level of the currently-held weapon.
r_drawviewmodel.remarks:
Example: 0.5 = 50% transparency.
r_drawviewmodel 2 will cause weapon to be hidden when fov > 90

r_drawvweps.desc: Whether to draw vweps (other players' weapon models).
r_drawvweps.remarks: In order for vweps to work, you must have the appropriate models (vwplayer.mdl and w_*.mdl), and the server you're playing on must have vwep support enabled.

values.name: false
values.description: Do not display renderer speed statistics.

r_enemyskincolor.desc: Allows you to set color for enemies you see in RGB format

r_explosionLight.desc: Size of the light effect around explosions.

r_explosionLightColor.desc: Determines the color of the explosion light.

r_explosionType.desc:
0 = Fire + sparks
1 = Fire only
2 = Teleport
3 = Blood
4 = Big blood
5 = Double gunshot
6 = Blob effect
7 = Big explosion
8 = Fuel Rod Gun Explosion
9 = Sparks

r_farclip.desc: Can be used to overcome vision being limited to 4096 units in GL clients (good for xpress2 etc).

values.name: true
values.description: Enable fastsky, helps fps a bit on maps with large sky areas.

values.name: false
values.description: All turbulences will be displayed normally.

values.name: true
values.description: All turbulences will be replaced by single-coloured surfaces.

r_floorcolor.desc:
Changes color of floors and ceilings when r_drawflat is set to 1.
Enter RGB value here, e.g. r_floorcolor "128 128 128" goes for gray floor.

r_fullbright.desc: This variable toggles the use of lights at full brightness on the map. This allows map authors to remove all of the lighting effects from the map, effectively removing all shadows.
r_fullbright.remarks:
This variable can only be used when the server is running with cheats enabled (for 
example "mvdsv -cheats" or sv_cheats 1), because it could be used as a cheat by making it easier
to see players in shadows.

values.name: true
values.description: Fullbrights the map (need -cheats or sv_cheats 1 enabled in server)

r_fullbrightSkins.desc:
Determines the fullbright percentage of skins. Fullbright skins can always be used during demo playback. 
The f_skins response will indicate the brightness level being used as a percentage.

r_glstats.desc: When enabled, it creates a window in the top right of the screen showing the number of particles and etc. in use.

r_lgbloodColor.desc: Determines the color of the blood (for standard particles). The QW-default value is 225.

Blend map textures and bsp entities (ammo, health etc.)

r_maxedges.desc:
This variable sets the maximum number of plane surface edges to be rendered.
Actual default (and minimal) value is 2000.
On some new maps you may need to increase this value.
See also r_maxsurfs, r_reportedgeout, r_reportsurfout.

r_maxsurfs.desc:
This variable sets the maximum number of plane surfaces to be rendered.
Actual default (and minimal) value is 2000.
On some new maps you may need to increase this value.
See also r_maxedges, r_reportedgeout, r_reportsurfout.

r_netgraph.desc:
Setting r_netgraph 1 is a diagnostic tool to help you tweak your rate. If you find that you suffer from short pauses in the game and you see red spikes in your netgraph, you should try setting the rate down a bit.
The height of the pink lines towards the bottom is your latency on received packets.
Red lines are lost packets. (bad)
Yellow lines are from the rate command kicking in, it's data that wasn't sent to you because you didn't have the bandwidth for it. (OK)
Blue lines are very bad, they invalid delta's, and are related to the U_REMOVE warnings.
r_netgraph.remarks: If during your play, you frequently see a string of messages with the term "U_REMOVE" in them, and your play seems to freeze for serveral seconds, use the console command cl_nodelta 1. This is a slightly less efficient way for QuakeWorld to work, but if your ISP is overloaded or has some configuration problems, it may not pass packets to QuakeWorld properly and cause difficulty.

r_netstats.desc: Shows information about ping, packetloss, average packet size and incoming/outgoing traffic. Equivalent with 'net' HUD element.

r_novis.desc:
This variable toggles the use of VIS information from the map data. When this 
variable is set to "1" the game will calculate it's own VIS information on the 
fly instead of using the information stored in the map data, this will cause 
a severe performance penalty in the game. When "r_novis" is set to "1", the 
variable "gl_turbalpha" has a value lower than "1" and the server allows the
client to display liquid transparently the player will be able to see through 
liquids. This is a nice effect to see but it is not recommended to keep this 
variable set to "1" because of the huge performance penalty. 
It is possible to enable transparent liquids and still keep this variable set to
"0" (and thus not experience such a severe performance drop) by using maps that
are VISed accordingly. You can visit the official Water VIS site at 
"http://www.sod.net/" and download the vispatch program along with the patch 
data files which you would use to update the VIS data for all of your game maps.
There are also map packs available that contain VISed versions of the original
ID maps.

values.name: false
values.description: Do not calculate VIS information for unVISed maps.

values.name: true
values.description: Calculate VIS information for unVISed maps.

values.name: false

r_tracker_messages.desc: Maximum number of custom frag messages to be displayed in extra frag messages window.

r_tracker_streaks.desc: Everytime a player makes a set number of consecutive kills, it will display a message showing they are on a streak, when the player is killed, it will display the name of the person who ended that streak.

rate.desc: Sets the maximum amount of bytes per second that the server should send to the client.

rcon_address.desc: Address of the server to query with remote console commands

rcon_password.desc: Password used for remote console communication

re_trigger_match_1.desc: First matched subpattern of the regexp match.

s_alsa_device.desc: Sets which device ALSA will be trying to open (when s_driver is set to alsa). Default is: "default", if that fails it will try "hw" and if that fails too, "plug:hw" will be tried.

s_alsa_latency.desc: Specifies latency for ALSA. If you got distortion in sound, upper the value a bit. If you experience delays, try lowering this value.

s_alsa_noworkaround.desc: If you are having problems with ALSA you can try to set this var to 1 before you try legacy drivers.

values.description: Workaround disabled. Try this if you are having problems with new ALSA driver.

s_ambientfade.desc: How fast the volume of ambient sounds changes as you move around the map.

s_ambientlevel.desc: Volume level of ambient sounds (produced by liquid and sky brushes).

s_bits.desc: This defines how many sampling bits should be used, when using 16 bits the interpolation quality will be better.
s_bits.remarks:
Linux only.
Use s_restart after you change it.

s_chat_custom.desc: Controls usage of s_mm*, s_chat_*, s_otherchat_* and s_spec_* variables.

values.description: Chat sounds played for mm1 & mm2
Chat sounds played for mm2 only

s_device.desc: Allows you to choose from multiple sound devices.
s_device.remarks:
Linux only.
Use s_restart after you change it.

For OSS you should use "/dev/dsp", "/dev/dsp0", "/dev/dsp1", etc
For ALSA use "default", "dmix", etc

s_driver.desc: Specifices which sounddriver to use: ALSA/OSS or experimental Pulseaudio.

values.name: pulse
values.description: Will use experimental Pulseaudio drivers (note: have to be set in all loading configs before starting ezQuake to work!)

s_khz.desc: The client includes "sound interpolation" which allows it to play sounds at higher frequencies, than the default 11025 Hz with perfect quality. In addition to "s_khz" also "s_bits" (linux only) will have an influence on interpolation quality. This variable allows you to choose the frequency you want to interpolate the sounds to. You will quickly discover, that the shaft sound is different at increased sampling rate. That's because shaft sounds were recorded at 22050 kHz, so probably that's how they should sound from the beginning. If you don't like it, you can always convert them to 11025.
s_khz.remarks: Also you can change it 'on fly' - just do s_restart after you change s_khz

s_linearresample.desc: Controls whether or not to resample sounds as they are loaded

values.description: Upscale sounds as they are loaded
Upscale & downscale sounds as they loaded, as appropriate

s_linearresample_stream.desc: This variable is no longer used, and has no effect.

s_loadas8bit.remarks:
This will give a little performance boost when playing the game at the cost of 
quality for the sound samples.)

values.name: true
values.description: On (The sound samples will be loaded in 8-bit mode thus making them a little smaller.

s_mixahead.desc:
Only affects OSS and legacy ALSA:

This variable defines the delay time for sounds. How low you can set your sound
mixahead depends on your FPS, when you set it too low, your sound will start 
crackling. Generally, with 72 FPS you should be able to use a delay of 0.06 seconds.

s_mm1_file.desc: You can specify notification sound for messagemode1 (/messagemode or /say foo) messages.

s_mm1_volume.desc: You can specify volume of notification sound for messagemode1 (/messagemode or /say foo) messages.

s_mm2_file.desc: You can specify notification sound for messagemode2 (/messagemode2 or /say_team foo) messages.

s_mm2_volume.desc: You can specify volume of notification sound for messagemode2 (/messagemode2 or /say_team foo) messages.

s_noalsa.desc: Determinates sound output for linux clients: ALSA (0=default) or OSS.
s_noalsa.remarks: If you dont know what is ALSA and OSS - leave it at default value.

values.name: false
values.description: Makes Quake update its sound buffers more often to avoid choppy sound when your fps is really low (20 or worse)

values.name: true
values.description: Don't use extra sound updates.  Gives a slight fps boost, but may lead to choppy sound on low-end machines

values.name: true
values.description: Disable the playback of sounds.  Note that it effectively just resets sound volume to zero, but the sound engine still runs.  If you want disable sound in order to get more fps, use the -nosound command line option instead.

s_oss_device.desc: Specifies which device OSS will try to open. Default is "/dev/dsp"

s_otherchat_file.desc: You can specify notification sound for other messages (than messagemode, messagemode2 and from spectators).

s_otherchat_volume.desc: You can specify volume of notification sound for other messages (than messagemode, messagemode2 and from spectators).

s_pulseaudio_latency.desc: Specifies latency for Pulseaudio. If you got distortion in sound, upper the value a bit. If you experience delays, try lowering this value.

s_desiredsamples.desc: Indicates how large the audio buffer should be, in samples.  If 0, ezQuake will choose a sensible default, based on value of s_khz
s_desiredsamples.remarks: This is a suggestion only, the driver is free to choose a different value.  Smaller buffer sizes generally result in lower latency, but higher CPU usage.

s_show.desc: Toggles displaying how many and/or which sound files are currently being played.

values.description: Print the number of sounds playing.
Print the volume in left/right speakers, name of sound file playing, and number of sounds playing.

s_spec_file.desc: You can specify notification sound for spectator messages.

s_spec_volume.desc: You can specify volume of notification sound for spectator messages.

s_stereo.remarks:
Linux only.
Use s_restart after you change it.

values.name: true

s_uselegacydrivers.desc: If you are having problems with the new ALSA/OSS drivers you can enable this to be able to use legacy sound drivers, as in the ones used before v2.1.

values.description: Will use new sound drivers for ALSA/OSS
Will use legacy drivers for ALSA/OSS (as used in versions before 2.1)

samelevel.desc:

when connecting to a server.

    only for rerouting features (with "useproxy 1")

sb_autoupdate.desc: Enabled auto-updates (pings & refreshes status) servers from actually marked server sources in Server Browser.
sb_autoupdate.remarks: Usefull with sb_starttab 1 and '+cfg_load myconfig +menu_slist' in command-line.

sb_hidedead.desc: This toggles whether ezQuake should hide dead servers.

sb_hideempty.desc: This toggles whether ezQuake should hide empty servers.

sb_hidefull.desc: This toggles whether ezQuake should hide full servers.

sb_hidehighping.desc: Remove servers with high ping from the server list and also exclude them from querying servers for details.

sb_hidenotempty.desc: This toggles whether ezQuake should hide empty servers.

sb_inforetries.desc:
This determines how often ezQuake should try to retrieve information from a server 
until it is considered to be not responding.

sb_infospersec.desc:
This determines how many serverinfos per second ezQuake should retrieve when 
scanning servers. When setting this value too high you will flood your line,
causing you to not receive information from servers or lagging your connect
to the server you are currently connected to.

sb_infotimeout.desc:
This determines how long ezQuake will wait for a reply when trying to retrieve
information from a server until the attempt times out.

sb_listcache.desc: Cache the list of alive servers and load it on next startup of the client.

sb_liveupdate.desc:
This will determine how often ezQuake should refresh the serverinfo window, the
specified value sets the delay in seconds. Setting it to "0" will disable
automatic refreshing.

sb_mastercache.desc:
This toggles whether ezQuake should cache the results of queries to master server 
(in directory qw/sb/cache). If you restart ezQuake and don't update sources or if 
a master server is down, ezQuake will use the cache.

values.name: false
values.description: don't use cache for master servers

values.name: true
values.description: use the cache for master servers when they are down or haven't been refreshed

sb_masterretries.desc:
This determines how often ezQuake should try to retrieve information from a master 
server until it is considered to be not responding.

sb_mastertimeout.desc:
This determines how long ezQuake will wait for a reply when trying to retrieve
information from a master server until the attempt times out.

sb_nosockraw.desc: Disable ICMP pinging in server browser and use UDP QW Ping packet to query servers for their ping (multithreaded).

sb_pinglimit.desc: Limit ping for servers to be visible when sb_hidehighping is enabled.

sb_pings.desc:
This determines how many pings ezQuake will send to a server when trying to
determine your ping to it. A higher value will cause scanning servers to take
longer, but the result may be more exact. A lower value obviously makes scanning
faster, but pings may be inaccurate.

sb_pingspersec.desc:
This determines how many pings per second ezQuake should sent out when scanning
servers. If you set this value too high the result will be that the pings will 
not be accurate because you overloaded your line. If you set it too low scanning 
servers will take very long especially when you have a large server list.

sb_pingtimeout.desc:
This determines how long ezQuake will wait for a reply when trying to ping a 
server until the attempt times out.

sb_proxinfopersec.desc:
Number of proxies to contact per second
Used when finding fastest path to a server.

sb_proxretries.desc: Number of times to attempt contact with a proxy before

sb_proxtimeout.desc: Timeout period (in ms) before a proxy connection times out.

that shows how many players are on the server as well as how many players are

sb_showproxies.desc: Toggle display of proxy servers (QWFwd and Qizmo) in the Server Browser.

values.description: Hide proxies in the server browser
Show proxies in the server browser
Only show proxies in the server browser

sb_showtimelimit.desc:
This toggles whether ezQuake should display the timelimit column in the server 
list.

values.name: false
values.description: do not show the timelimit column

sb_sortplayers.desc:
This determines sort order in the players list. This uses the numbers from the
description of the columns. Check "Columns available in servers/players list"
above for an explanation of each number. A "-" in front of the value reverses 
the sort order for that value from ascending to descending.
address (ip:port).

sb_sortservers.desc:
This determines sort order in the servers list. This uses the numbers from the
description of the columns. Check "Columns available in servers/players list" 
above for an explanation of each number. A "-" in front of the value reverses 
the sort order for that value from ascending to descending.
server address (ip:port).

sb_sortsources.desc: Ordering instructions for server browser sources list are stored in this variable. You can order source server in Server browser by pressing Ctrl+1, Ctrl+2 and Ctrl+3. Sequence of your desired combination will be stored in this variable, newest keys first.

values.description: E.g.: 3-21 means you've pressed Ctrl+1, Ctrl+2, Ctrl+2 and Ctrl+3 so your sources are now ordered by server count, last update time and source name.

sb_sourcevalidity.desc:
This sets the time of master servers validity in minutes. Master servers that
were updated within the specified time will not be refreshed when updating 
sources with [SPACE].

sb_status.desc:
This toggles whether the server status should be displayed in the two bottom 
lines of the server browser.

scr_cursor_alpha.desc: Level of transparency of the cursor used in menus and HUD editor.

scr_cursor_iconoffset_x.desc: Offset of the cursor image used in menus and HUD editor.

scr_cursor_iconoffset_y.desc: Offset of the cursor image used in menus and HUD editor.

scr_cursor_scale.desc: Size of the cursor image used in menus and HUD editor.

scr_cursor_sensitivity.desc: Mouse sensitivity for the cursor used in menus and HUD editor.

scr_drawHFrags.desc: Displays horizontal bar with frag stats (4 cells) in the old hud.
scr_drawHFrags.remarks: Required settings for this to work: scr_newhud 0 or 2, viewsize below 110, cl_sbar 1 or cl_sbar 0 but vid_conwidth below 512; if you migrated from FuhQuake and can't get this to work, check these settings, the feature should work the same as in FuhQuake

scr_drawVFrags.desc: Shows vertical row with frag stats on the right side of the old hud. When teamplay mode is on, will display also frags per team.
scr_drawVFrags.remarks: Note: vid_conwidth must be at least 512, scr_centerSbar must be disabled; works only in deathmatch, not in cooperative

scr_fovmode.desc: Determines how to keep aspect ratio correct when viewsize is reduced.

values.description: Standard QWCL behaviour - reduce vertical fov, cropping image
Reduce horizontal size, keeping aspect ratio correct

scr_menualpha.desc: Opacity of the main menu's background.

scr_menudrawhud.desc: Draw HUD elements/crosshair/etc in background of main menu. Useful when HUD distracting you in server browser.

values.name: false
values.description: Don't draw HUD elements when in menus.

values.name: true
values.description: Draw HUD elements when in menus.
First draws old status bar and then renders new status bar on the top of it.

scr_newhud_clear.desc: Force full screen refresh on low viewsize values to prevent uncleared HUD elements background.

values.name: false
values.description: The notify area is hidden during intermission (chat messages go to console but not to screen)

values.name: true
values.description: The notify area is always shown

scr_printspeed.desc:
This variable controls how fast the text is displayed at the end of the single 
player episodes.

scr_qtvbuffer.desc: Enables display of the QTV buffer status
scr_qtvbuffer.remarks: Makes it able to check how much of the stream is buffered on the client side

scr_qtvbuffer_x.desc: Horizontal position of the qtvbuffer counter

scr_qtvbuffer_y.desc: Vertical position of the qtvbuffer counter

scr_sbar_drawammo.desc: Turns drawing amount of ammo on/off.
scr_sbar_drawammo.remarks: This variable applies for old HUD <= 'scr_newhud 0'.

scr_sbar_drawammocounts.desc: Turns drawing amounts of ammo on/off.
scr_sbar_drawammocounts.remarks: This variable applies for old HUD <= 'scr_newhud 0'.

values.name: false
values.description: Do not draw countrs of ammo.

scr_sbar_drawammoicon.desc: Turns drawing of ammo icon on/off.
scr_sbar_drawammoicon.remarks: This variable applies for old HUD <= 'scr_newhud 0'.

scr_sbar_drawarmor.desc: Turns drawing of armor count on/off.
scr_sbar_drawarmor.remarks: This variable applies for old HUD <= 'scr_newhud 0'.

scr_sbar_drawarmoricon.desc: Turns drawing of armor icon on/off.
scr_sbar_drawarmoricon.remarks: This variable applies for old HUD <= 'scr_newhud 0'.

scr_sbar_drawfaceicon.desc: Turns drawing of face icon on/off.
scr_sbar_drawfaceicon.remarks: This variable applies for old HUD <= 'scr_newhud 0'.

scr_sbar_drawguns.desc: Turns drawing of available guns on/off.
scr_sbar_drawguns.remarks: This variable applies for old HUD <= 'scr_newhud 0'.

scr_sbar_drawhealth.desc: Turns drawing of health amount on/off.
scr_sbar_drawhealth.remarks: This variable applies for old HUD <= 'scr_newhud 0'.

scr_sbar_drawitems.desc: Turns drawing of items (powerups and keys) in status bar on/off.
scr_sbar_drawitems.remarks: This variable applies for old HUD <= 'scr_newhud 0'.

values.name: false
values.description: Do not draw items in status bar.

scr_sbar_drawsigils.remarks: This variable applies for old HUD <= 'scr_newhud 0'.

values.name: true
values.description: Scales the frontend menu to match the resolution you are using.

scr_scoreboard_afk.desc: If set, indicate players who are AFK (don't have Quake active)

scr_scoreboard_afk_style.desc: Affects how a player being away from the game is reflected in scoreboard.

values.description: If user is AFK, time replaced with AFK
If user is AFK, time value shown in red

values.name: false
values.description: no scoreboard border will be displayed

scr_scoreboard_death_color.desc: Changes the color of the "dths" (deaths) column in your scoreboard when >0. Uses RGB values.

scr_scoreboard_drawfps.desc: Substitutes the "time" column with a "FPS" in scores showing how much FPS each player has.

values.name: true
values.description: Replace time with FPS in scoreboard

scr_scoreboard_fadescreen.desc: shadowing level, when scoreboard is displayed.

values.name: false
values.description: When you overwrite team/enemy color it will use only those colors for skins

values.name: true
values.description: When you overwrite team/enemy color it will use only those colors for skins and scoreboard

scr_scoreboard_kill_color.desc: Changes the color of the "kills" column in your scoreboard when >0. Uses RGB values.

scr_scoreboard_posx.desc: Controls the X-offset of the scoreboard.

values.description: If 0, scoreboard will be shown at the left of the screen (scr_scoreboard_centered 0) or middle (scr_scoreboard_centered 1). If nonzero, the scoreboard will be shifted left (negative values) or right (positive values).

scr_scoreboard_posy.desc: Controls the Y-offset of the scoreboard.

values.description: If 0, scoreboard will be shown at the top of the screen. If nonzero, the scoreboard will be shifted down.

scr_scoreboard_spectator_name.desc: This variable will change what spectators are called in the scoreboard. When teamplay is not on, this variable is cut to 4 characters. &cRGB values are not accepted.

scr_scoreboard_tk_color.desc: Changes the color of the "tks" column in your scoreboard when >0. Uses RGB values.

scr_showcrosshair.desc: Allows you to force the display of the crosshair when in menus or in scoreboard

scr_shownick_frame_color.desc: If using '/shownick 1' in KTX, this determines the color of the frame around the on-screen information

scr_shownick_name_width.desc: Maximum length of player's name when using '/shownick 1' in KTX

scr_shownick_order.desc: Format string for results of '/shownick 1' in KTX

scr_shownick_scale.desc: Adjusts relative size of text when showing results of '/shownick 1' in KTX

scr_shownick_time.desc: Number of seconds to show results of '/shownick 1' command in KTX

scr_shownick_x.desc: Horizontal position of the shownick label

scr_shownick_y.desc: Vertical position of the shownick label

scr_spectatorMessage.desc: Switch on/off the text at the bottom of the screen when spectating in free mode: "SPECTATOR MODE | PRESS [ATTACK] for AutoCamera"

scr_teaminfo.desc: Displays team info when you are spectating or watching mvd demo.

values.description: Displays teammates' armor always in white.
Displays teammates' armor in white with the icon of the armor they have next to it.
Displays teammates' armor in the color of the armor they have.

scr_teaminfo_frame_color.desc: Changes the color and transparency of scr_teaminfo's frame.

scr_teaminfo_low_health.desc: Sets a minimum health value to display red. E.g. if scr_teaminfo_low_health is 20, and a teammate has 20 health or less, then their health will be displayed red.

scr_teaminfo_order.desc: Changes the order of displayed items in scr_teaminfo

scr_teaminfo_powerup_style.desc: Controls how powerup indicators are displayed in scr_teaminfo

scr_teaminfo_show_enemies.desc: Will show enemy players in the teaminfo table.
scr_teaminfo_show_enemies.remarks: Works only for MVD playback (servers do not send info about enemies to you anyway).

values.name: false
values.description: Do not show enemy players status

values.name: true
values.description: Show enemy players status in teaminfo table

scr_teaminfo_show_self.desc: Will show row with the status of the current player in the teaminfo table.

values.description: Do not show tracked player status in the teaminfo table
Show tracked player in the teaminfo table
Show tracked player when watching demos/QTV only

values.name: false
values.description: Displays teammates' weapon as an icon

values.name: true
values.description: Displays teammates' weapon as a word (rl, lg, etc..)

scr_tracking.desc: Changes the format of descriptive text displayed when you are tracking someone as spectator or watching a demo where you can see player's team and name.
scr_tracking.remarks: This variable affects scr_newhud 0. To change same text in new HUD (scr_newhud 1) use /tracking format (hud_tracking_format) settings.

values.description: Pattern %n will be replaced with tracked player's name, %t will be replaced with player's team.

scr_weaponstats.desc: Displays weapons stats on server that support it

values.name: false
values.description: Displays weapon stats on the left hand side of the screen

values.name: true
values.description: Displays weapon stats on the right hand side of the screen

scr_weaponstats_frame_color.desc: Sets the color of the frame around scr_weaponstats display

scr_weaponstats_order.desc:
Accept next tokens %1 %2 %3 ... %8 which expands in to weapons accuracy, %1 - axe, %2 - sg ... %8 - lg.

But, for axe accuracy is useless, so better use direct hits instead, for that you must use it like #1.

Unrecognized tokens printed as-is, so for axe order will looks like "axe: #1" - that means print string "axe: " and axe hits.

Also variable supports ezquake color sequences.

scr_weaponstats_scale.desc: Controls size of scr_weaponstats display.  1 = Normal text size

scr_weaponstats_x.desc: Horizontal placement of the weapon stats table

scr_weaponstats_y.desc: Vertical placement of the weapon stats table

sensitivity.desc:
This variable sets the sensitivity of the mouse, it is one of the most important 
variables in the whole game.

values.name: false
values.description: Disables the display of the frames-per-second value.

values.name: true
values.description: Enables the display of the frames-per-second value.

show_fps_x.desc: Determine where the show_fps is positioned on your screen on the X co-ordinate.

show_fps_y.desc: Determine where the show_fps is positioned on your screen on the Y co-ordinate.

show_speed.desc: Displays a speed counter in the top right corner in the client's units (Horizontal velocity). (320 - Normal walking speed, 440 - Accel jump, 450 - Bunnyhopping)

values.description: More accurate counter (Best used when LPB).

show_speed_x.desc: Determine where the show_speed is positioned on your screen on the X co-ordinate.

show_speed_y.desc: Determine where the show_speed is positioned on your screen on the Y co-ordinate.

show_velocity_3d.desc: Shows your velocity as 3d vector and its projections (*GL ONLY*).

values.name: false
values.description: Disable text dump printing dropped packets

values.name: true
values.description: Enable text dump printing dropped packets

values.name: false
values.description: Do not display information about all network packets.

values.name: true
values.description: Display information about all network packets.

values.name: true
values.description: Display that the pause icon is displayed when the game is paused.

values.name: true
values.description: Display the ram icon when running out of memory

values.name: true
values.description: Display the turtle icon when your frame rate drops below 10.

skin.desc: Sets the skin name for the player.

skin_browser_democolor.desc: Color of the demo entries in the skin browser

skin_browser_dircolor.desc: Color of the dir entries in the skin browser

skin_browser_interline.desc: Size of the space between entries in the skin browser

skin_browser_scrollnames.desc: Toggle scrolling of the filenames in the skin browser

skin_browser_selectedcolor.desc: Color of the selected entries in the skin browser

skin_browser_showdate.desc: Toggle the date column in the skin browser

skin_browser_showsize.desc: Toggle the file size column in the skin browser

skin_browser_showstatus.desc: Toggle the display of the status bar in the skin browser

skin_browser_showtime.desc: Toggle the time column in the skin browser

skin_browser_sortmode.desc: Sorting mode in the skin browser. Each number represents one column. Their order represents the priority of the sorting.

skin_browser_stripnames.desc: Toggle stripping of the filenames in the skin browser

skin_browser_zipcolor.desc: Color of the zip entries in the skin browser

spectator_password.desc: A password spectators must use to connect to local server

sshot_autoname.desc: Add the map name as screenshot filename prefix.

sshot_format.desc:
tga = Tga screenshots (gl only)
png = Png screenshots
jpg = Jpg screenshots (gl only)
pcx = Pcx screenshots (software only)

sv_accelerate.desc: Sets the acceleration value for the player.

sv_aim.desc: Sets the value for auto-aiming leniency.

sv_airaccelerate.desc: Sets how quickly the player accelerates in air.

sv_downloadchunksperframe.desc: Limits the speed of the chunked downloads
sv_downloadchunksperframe.remarks: Server-side. Clients can set high amount of chunks per frame allowed and make your data eat connection traffic rapidly. Use this variable to prevent this.

sv_forcenqprogs.desc: Force loading of NetQuake progs - if progs.dat (typically from Quake 1 sigle player / mods) is present in the gamedir, it will be preferred over qwprogs.dat and spprogs.dat (QW game mods).

sv_friction.desc: Sets the friction value for the player.

sv_gravity.desc: Sets the global value for the amount of gravity.

values.name: true
values.description: Enable high character color names for players.

values.name: true
values.description: Enable custom map entity file support.

sv_mapcheck.remarks:
Note: A player who has edited his map files to cheat by removing textures 
from walls will not be able to join the server and play.

values.name: true
values.description: Enable map checksumming to check for players who edit maps to cheat.

sv_maxpitch.desc: server-side variable for setting maximum of view angles
sv_maxpitch.remarks: EZQuake and ZQuake (may be some other) clients understand this physics change, old clients will be clamped at [-70~80] (quakeworld default) view angles.

values.description: By default, in quakeworld maximum viewangle is '80'. You can set for example '90' then you will be able look directly to sky. q3 players should like it

sv_maxspeed.desc: Sets the maximum speed a player can move.

sv_maxtic.desc:
The maximum amount of time in seconds before a client a receives an update 
from the server.

sv_maxvelocity.desc: Sets the maximum velocity an object can travel.

sv_minpitch.desc: server-side variable for setting minimum of view angles
sv_minpitch.remarks: EZQuake and ZQuake (may be some other) clients understand this physics change, old clients will be clamped at [-70~80] (quakeworld default) view angles.

values.description: By default, in quakeworld minimum viewangle is '-70'. You can set for example '-90' then you will be able look directly to floor. q3 players should like it.

sv_mintic.desc:
The minimum amount of time the server will wait before sending packets to 
a client.

sv_nailhack.remarks: smoother and point in the right direction.

values.name: true
values.description: Allows nails in most cases to uses less bandwidth and to fly around

sv_paused.desc: read-only variable that gives you current pause state (condition).

values.description: normal pause that can be set by 'pause' command
auto pause (single player only) when going into menus

values.name: true
values.description: Has something to do with the table which is build at the loading time

sv_spectatormaxspeed.desc: Sets the maximum speed a spectator can move.

sv_stopspeed.desc: Sets the value that determines how fast the player should come to a complete stop.

sv_timeout.desc:
Sets the amount of time in seconds before a client is considered disconnected 
if the server does not receive a packet.

sys_disableWinKeys.remarks: Note: Windows keys are now bindable (LWINKEY, RWINKEY, WINKEY, POPUPMENU). Obviously only useful on NT/2K/XP with sys_disableWinKeys 1 (and possibely useful in Linux too!).

values.name: true
values.description: Disable winkeys from alt-tabbing you (only works in NT/2K/XP, and only when the client is in focus).

values.name: false
values.description: Prevent freeing of CPU when the client is minimized or not in focus.

sys_inactivesound.desc: Enables sounds when the application is not focused

sys_yieldcpu.desc: Controls CPU sharing when client is waiting to draw a frame. When disabled, client will run a loop, actively waiting for the time to draw a new frame. When enabled, client will call system sleep function during the waiting, which will cause the thread to be deactivated for a while - leading to significantly lower CPU usage in most cases.

values.name: false
values.description: Do not sleep between frames, use CPU as much as possible.

values.name: true
values.description: Sleep between frames, make CPU available for other processes.

teambothskin.desc: Overrides the team quad pent skin so you can define the skin which applies to team quads pents.

teambottomcolor.desc: Determines the color of the pants of the teammates you see. Overrides player's skin settings.
teambottomcolor.remarks: To be able to use RGB 24bit colors, look for r_teamskincolor variable.

teamforceskins.desc: Allows you to set different skin for every team player even if they all have same skin names set or use names of skins that you do not have in your Quake dir
teamforceskins.remarks: Read "Player skins" manual page for more info on skin rules.

values.description: Use player's name as the name of the skin to be used
Use player's userid number (only useful for video capturing)
Assign skins "t1", "t2", "t3", etc. to your teammates.

teamlock.desc: Observing feature. Do not toggle enemy recognition when you switch players. One team will always remain marked as enemy even if you spec their players.

values.description: Either 0 or 1 to turn this feature on / off, or put in the name of the team that will always be recognized as not-enemy.

teampentskin.desc: Overrides the team pent skin so you can define the skin which applies to team pents.

teamplay.remarks: Nowadays only value 2 is used; value 1 prevents you from killing your teammates including yourself

teamquadskin.desc: Overrides the team quad skin so you can define the skin which applies to team quads.

teamskin.desc: Overrides the team skin so you can define the skin which applies to team mates.

teamtopcolor.desc: Determines the color of the shirt of the teammates you see. Overrides player's skin settings.
teamtopcolor.remarks: To be able to use RGB 24bit colors, look for r_teamskincolor variable.

telnet_password.desc: Password for login via telnet.  Not currently used.

timelimit.desc: Number of minutes the match will take

tp_forceTriggers.desc: Controls whether f_took, f_death etc are forced to execute even if the game isn't a team game.

tp_loadlocs.desc:
Controls whether to load locs for teamplay reporting.
Note: The locs should be in your "/id1/locs/",
"/ezquake/locs" or "/qw/locs" folder.

tp_msgtriggers.remarks: For ruleset 'Smackdown' message triggers always are off.

tp_name_armortype_ga.desc: Customizes output of %A macro for green armor.

tp_name_armortype_ra.desc: Customizes output of %A macro for red armor.

tp_name_armortype_ya.desc: Customizes output of %A macro for yellow armor.

tp_name_eyes.desc: Sets the name for ring (invisibility) powerup for teamplay messages.

tp_name_filter.desc: TF only - added to end of tp_msgtfconced message

tp_name_rune1.desc: Sets name of the first rune (Resistance Rune) used for teamplay messages.

tp_name_rune2.desc: Sets name of the second rune (Strength Rune) used for teamplay messages.

tp_name_rune3.desc: Sets name of the third rune (Haste Rune) used for teamplay messages.

tp_name_rune4.desc: Sets name of the fourth rune (Regeneration Rune) used for teamplay messages.

tp_name_sentry.desc: Sets the name for sentry tower in teamplay messages.

tp_name_status_white.remarks: tp_name_status_ cvars are used by the client when generating teamplay messages

tp_pointpriorities.desc: You can choose the way the client decides what object you want to point with $point macro.
tp_pointpriorities.remarks: Priorities of object are given in tp_point command. You have to type all objects manually in tp_point command. Example: tp_point quad ra mh health. In this example, quad has the highest priority and $point will always return quad if quad ra mh are all in your view. Example: tp_point all. You never know what object will be pointed because all objects get the same priority.

values.name: false
values.description: Original, default behavior. The closest object will be chosen.

values.name: true
values.description: Object with highest priority will be chosen. First items in tp_point have highest priorities.

tp_pointtimeout.desc: Time (in seconds) before the last pointed item (%j) is cleared.

tp_soundtrigger.desc:
SoundTrigger like proxys.
A SoundTrigger must be terminated by either a CR, LF or filter. The .wav extension is not required at the end. Trigger is a character before the sound file.
Example:
filter #a
say_team I'm at %l ~location.wav"
say_team ~location.wav$\me: I'm at %l #a"
say_team ~location$\me: I'm at %l #a"
say_team I'm at %l ~location #a"

tp_tooktimeout.desc: Time (in seconds) before the last item taken (%X) is cleared.

tp_weapon_order.desc:
This allows you to define the order from best to worst weapon. The default value
is "78564321", which means that the Rocket Launcher is the best weapon (impulse 7)
then Lightning Gun (impulse 8), Super Nailgun (impulse 5), Grenade Launcher
(impulse 6), Nailgun (impulse 4), Super Shotgun (impulse 3), Shotgun (impulse 2),
Axe (impulse 1).

userdir.desc:
userdir [dir [type]]
Addition of the given directory to the list searched files

v_centermove.desc:
This variable sets the distance that the player must move before the screen 
automatically centers itself when "lookspring" is set to "1". This variable is 
only useful to people who only play with the keyboard, have "lookspring" set to
"1" and do not have "+klook" or "+mlook" enabled at that time. When the player 
moves the distance specified in this variable the screen will pop back to the 
center position.

v_centerspeed.desc:
This variable sets how quickly your view returns to the center after looking up
or down and moving after that and "lookspring" is set to "1". This variable is 
only useful to people who only play with the keyboard, have "lookspring" set to
"1" and do not have "+klook" or "+mlook" enabled at that time. When the player 
moves the distance specified in this variable the screen will pop back to the 
center position.

v_contentblend.desc: Turning this variable on will temporarily change the hue of your screen when inside liquid (water/slime/lava) (requires gl_polyblend 1)
v_contentblend.remarks: Specify a percentage value, between 0 and 1.  0 turns the effect off.

v_damagecshift.desc: This variable (0..1) will temporarily add a red hue to your screen when you've taken damage. Needs gl_polyblend 1.

v_dlightcshift.desc: Turning this variable on will blend light when you're inside a light bubble. Also need to set gl_flashblend 1

v_gunkick.desc: Kickback effect when the weapon is fired.

v_idlescale.desc:
This variable controls the amount that the screen should sway automatically.
When this variable is set to a value above "0" the screen will start swaying in 
all directions, similar as if the player was drunk of had a concussion. If you 
want to have some real fun, set this variable to a value of "100" and run around 
some maps. The larger the value for this variable the more the screen will sway 
from side to side.

v_ipitch_cycle.desc:
This variable controls the speed at which the screen should sway up and down
when "v_idlescale" is set to a value above "0".

v_ipitch_level.desc: This variable controls the distance that the screen should sway up and down when "v_idlescale" is set to a value above "0".

v_iroll_cycle.desc:
This variable controls the speed at which the screen should roll clockwise and 
counter clockwise when "v_idlescale" is set to a value above "0".

v_iroll_level.desc:
This variable controls the distance the screen should roll clockwise and counter
clockwise when "v_idlescale" is set to a value above "0".

v_iyaw_cycle.desc: Sets how quickly you look left and right when v_idlescale is active.

v_iyaw_level.desc: Sets how far you look left and right when v_idlescale is active.

v_kickpitch.desc:
This variable controls the distance that the screen should move up or down when 
the player is shot. Most players set this variable to "0" in order to remove the 
screen tilting effect when they are injured by a shot. This allows them to keep 
a perfect aim while being fired upon.
v_kickpitch.remarks: v_kicktime must be >0 for this to take effect.

v_kickroll.desc:
This variable controls the distance that the screen should roll clockwise or 
counter clockwise when the player is shot. Most players set this variable to "0"
in order to remove the screen tilting effect when they are injured by a shot. 
This allows them to keep a perfect aim while being fired upon.
v_kickroll.remarks: v_kicktime must be >0 for this to take effect.

v_kicktime.desc: This variable controls the amount of time v_kickpitch and v_kickroll take effect.

v_pentcshift.desc: This variable (0..1) will add a temporary red hue to your screen if you are carry the Pent powerup. Requires gl_polyblend 1

v_quadcshift.desc: This variable (0..1) will add a temporary blue hue to your screen if you are carry the Quad powerup. Requires gl_polyblend 1

v_ringcshift.desc: This variable (0..1) will add a temporary yellow hue to your screen if you are carry the Ring powerup. Requires gl_polyblend 1

v_suitcshift.desc: This variable (0..1) will add a temporary green hue to your screen if you are carry the Suit powerup. Requires gl_polyblend 1

v_viewheight.desc:
New variable v_viewheight can be used to get the effect of negative/zero values 
of cl_bobcycle etc in qw 2.33 . Negative values of v_viewheight = lower viewheight, 
positive = higher. Can't go below -7 or above 4 because that's the range you can get 
with qw 2.33 by exploiting the bob cycle bug. Using v_viewheight automatically 
turns off weapon model bobbing (cl_bob*).

vid_24bit_depth.remarks: Visual artifacts may be visible if using a 16-bit depth-buffer (e.g. entities disappearing at distance)

values.name: false
values.description: Size of depth-buffer will be system default

vid_borderless.desc: When in windowed mode, window will not have a border

vid_conaspect.desc: Keep the screen proportions to given aspect ratio.
vid_conaspect.remarks: Always changes vid_conheight when you change vid_conwidth.

vid_config_x.desc:
This variable sets the width of the vid_mode 2 window, the minimum possible
value is "640".

vid_config_y.desc:
This variable sets the width of the vid_mode 2 window, the minimum possible
value is "400"

vid_conheight.remarks: Cannot be higher than the height of the current game resolution.

vid_conscale.desc: If vid_conwidth & vid_conheight are set to 0, vid_conheight will be scaled by the value of this variable

vid_conwidth.remarks: Can\'t be higher than the height of the current game resolution

vid_customheight.desc: Screen resolution width for custom screen mode

vid_customwidth.desc: Screen resolution height for custom screen mode

vid_displayfrequency.desc: Sets horizontal frequency for your monitor (in hertz - Hz).

vid_displaynumber.desc: Display/screen to use when in fullscreen mode.
vid_displaynumber.remarks: Use vid_displaylist command to enumerate displays.

vid_flashonactivity.desc: When there is activity in the server, ezQuake's taskbar window will flash. Activity includes chat, high priority messages, disconnection from server.

vid_forcerestoregamma.desc: Force restore gamma after returning to minimized application.
vid_forcerestoregamma.remarks: Might be usefull if you have ATI card.

vid_fullscreen.desc: Enables fullscreen mode, when disabled, sets windowed mode

vid_fullscreen_mode.desc:
This variable sets the full screen video mode that the game will switch to when
the "vid_fullscreen" command is executed.

vid_height.desc: Determines width of screen resolution when in fullscreen mode
vid_height.remarks: This value is ignored if vid_usedesktopres is set.

values.description: Enables hwgamma control for fullscreen mode.
Enables hwgamma control for fullscreen and windowed mode.
Enables hwgamma even when window focus is lost but not minimized (Xorg only)

vid_mode.desc:
This variables sets the next video mode to be used, any change of this variable
will cause the video mode to be changed immediately.

vid_nopageflip.desc:
This variable toggles the use of page-flipping during supported video modes. By 
default the game will allow for page-flipping for video modes that support this 
feature. For example if a given VESA mode can support page flipping, then it 
defaults to page-flipped operation.  A VESA mode can be forced to 
non-page-flipped operation by setting the "vid_nopageflip" variable to "1", then
setting the mode (note that "vid_nopageflip" takes operation on the next, 
not the current video mode, and note that it then stays in effect permanently, 
even when the client is exited and restarted, unless it is manually set back to "0").
If there is not enough memory for two pages in a VESA mode, or if the adapter 
doesn't support page flipping, then the mode will automatically be 
non-page-flipped.  
Page-flipping works by drawing multiple virtual game screens at the same time in 
the video memory and then switching among them to display the current 
gamescreen. Page-flipped modes thus use less system memory than non-page-flipped 
modes, but require more video memory. When using page-flipping, visual quality 
may be higher, but performance of the game can change to better or worse, 
depending on the graphics adapter and other hardware (see the discussion of the 
Pentium Pro below, for a discussion of why page flipping can be faster but is 
sometimes much slower on that processor). However in most cases the performance 
(and thus frame rate) will be increased, but for people with hardware that has 
problems with page-flipping "vid_nopageflip 1" may help.
The Pentium Pro is an example for such a hardware: it is an okay client platform (sniff!), 
but it has one weak spot, it is by default very slow on writes to video memory.  
This means that in default hardware configurations, you are usually much better 
off setting "vid_nopageflip" to "1" if you use VESA modes, so drawing is done to 
system memory instead of to video memory. Remember that you must set the mode
after setting "vid_nopageflip" to "1" in order to get "vid_nopageflip" to take
effect. "vid_nopageflip 1" can sometimes be faster on a Pentium too, but not by 
nearly as much in general, and it's often slower.

vid_resetonswitch.remarks:
ezQuake and the screen gets garbaged. When enabled, the client will reset your Windows video mode 
every time you press alt-tab. Note that some NVidia drivers lock up your system completely 
when you alt-tab. vid_resetonswitch will not help in this case (try starting ezQuake with -dibonly).

vid_stretch_by_2.remarks: half-resolution in each direction and stretched up to the specified size.)

vid_usedesktopres.desc: If set, vid_width/vid_height are ignored, and desktop resolution is used instead.

vid_verbose.desc: If set, display graphics info on every vid_restart

vid_vsync.desc: Syncs your FPS with your monitor's vertical refresh rate. This will override cl_maxfps.

vid_vsync_lag_fix.desc: Enables experimental fix for a delay vertical synchronization mode
vid_vsync_lag_fix.remarks: When vid_vsync is set to 1, an artificial delay in the input can appear, enabling this should eliminate the delay

vid_vsync_lag_tweak.desc: Custom value for experimental vertical synchronization delay reduction.
vid_vsync_lag_tweak.remarks: Too low values (0.2 or lower) may significantly decrease FPS and make it not synced with display frequency. Too high values (10 and above) may turn off the effect of video lag fix completely. Use the lowest value that keeps stable FPS for you.

vid_wideaspect.desc: Recalculates screen proportions so that they suit wide-screen displays. If you toggle this variable from 0 to 1, it will recalculate your field of view (fov) and screen proportions (conwidth/conheight ratio) so that the resulting image looks similar on a 16:10 screen as it did on 4:3 screen.
vid_wideaspect.remarks: The effect of the variable is only changing values of "fov" and "vid_conheight" variables when you toggle the value of this variable. The algorithm used to get resulting values is described in the QuakeWorld wiki.

values.name: false
values.description: Keep the settings suitable for 4:3 screen.

vid_width.desc: Determines width of screen resolution when in fullscreen mode
vid_width.remarks: This value is ignored if vid_usedesktopres is set.

vid_win_borderless.desc: If set, windowed mode will be in a borderless window (no title)

vid_win_displaynumber.desc: Display/screen to use when in windowed mode.
vid_win_displaynumber.remarks: Use vid_displaylist command to enumerate displays.

vid_win_height.desc: Height of display when in windowed mode.

vid_win_save_pos.desc: If set, window position variables will be set as window moved around screen

vid_win_save_size.desc: If set, window size variables will be set as window resized

vid_win_width.desc: Width of display when in windowed mode.

vid_window_x.desc:
This variable sets the x-axis location of the top left corner of the game window 
on the desktop.

vid_window_y.desc:
This variable sets the y-axis location of the top left corner of the game window 
on the desktop.

vid_windowed_mode.desc:
This variable sets the windowed video mode that the game will switch to when the 
"vid_windowed" command is executed.

vid_xpos.desc: Horizontal position of the client window.

vid_ypos.desc: Vertical position of the client window

viewsize.desc: This variable determines how large the viewable screen size is.
viewsize.remarks: Value range is 30-120.  Values 100 & 110 are affected by cl_sbar

values.description: Large screen size, without the weapons status bar.
Maximum screen size, without any status bars.

volume.remarks: Even higher values than 1 are possible, but sound usually gets faithless with them.

that is used to switch to a certain weapon:

watervis.desc: This server-side cvar is mirrored to serverinfo as a hint to clients on whether the server is using the so-called watervised maps.
watervis.remarks:
It's a bad idea to use watervis 1 if the maps the server is using are not watervised. Liquids will appear 'transparent' but you won't be able to see any items/players/etc through it.  And it is a bad idea anyway because Quake maps were not designed for transparent water (or other liquids); enabling it changes gameplay, decreases fps and produces more network traffic and puts non-GL players at a disadvantage because the software renderer doesn't support transparent water (yet).
Not saved to config with cfg_save command.

values.name: true
values.description: GLQuake users can see through liquids if they set gl_turbalpha to a value < 1.

zombietime.desc:
The number of minutes that the server will keep the character of a player on 
the map who seems to have disconnected.
